title: VIDEO: Sour Bicycles – Quinda Bike Check | Traka 560 2024
content:
Sour Bicycles‘ athlete Quinda is embarking on an ITT of the Traka Adventure race even after the 560km course was canceled this year due to severe weather. Race organizers do this for a number of reasons but the bottom line is, that didn’t stop Quinda…

The race that never was! Even though the 560km Traka Adventure was delayed and later canceled due to extreme weather, that didn’t stop Quinda from starting an ITT of the race course. That means Sour Bicycles is here to share her setup. Follow Quinda on Spot.

**Note: the race wasn’t canceled for fun, the weather conditions hanging over the Spanish coast right now are no joke, but Quinda is a very experienced ultra-cyclist and with the help of other locals, she is making a calculated decision to proceed with the ITT**

Check out the spec list:

Bike: Sour Pasta Party, Size Medium
Fork: Fox 32 Factory Stepcast
Wheels: Hope Pro 5 and SON dynamo w/ Duke Lucky Jack SLS4
Tires: Schwalbe Thunder Burt 2,35/2,2″
Drivetrain: Hope Evo cranks, 32t x 10-52t SRAM Eagle Cassette
Dropper: Crank Brothers Highline 27.2mm
Hope finishing kit and Pro Missile aero bars

The post VIDEO: Sour Bicycles – Quinda Bike Check | Traka 560 2024 appeared first on The Radavist.
author: John Watson
